BasicDescription.Title: Book Of The Week
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Peacemakers: By Margaret MacMillan. Part 1, The Delegates: For the first six months of 1919 Paris effectively became the capital of the world.

Peacemakers
By Margaret MacMillan, read by Jane Lapotaire.
Part 1, The Delegates:
For the first six months of 1919 Paris effectively became the capital of the world as the heads of state of over 30 countries gathered to try and create a new world order in the wake of the first world war.

BasicDescription.Title: The Archers
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Chaba's feeling vulnerable.

BasicDescription.Title: Midnight News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: Shipping Forecast
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest Shipping Forecast.

BasicDescription.Title: As BBC World Service
BasicDescription.Synopsis: BBC Radio 4 joins the BBC World Service for a selection of news and current affairs, arts and science programmes. BBC Radio 4 resumes at 5.35am.

BasicDescription.Title: Radio 4 Open Up
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Includes a News Summary, the latest Shipping and Inshore Waters forecasts, and Prayer For The Day.

BasicDescription.Title: Farming Today
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Agricultural news and features with Miriam O'Reilly.

BasicDescription.Title: Today
BasicDescription.Synopsis: With Edward Stourton and James Naughtie. Includes Sports Desk at 6.25am, 7.25am and 8.25am; Weather at 6.55am and 7.55am; Thought For The Day at 7.45am. Yesterday In Parliament at 6.45am.

BasicDescription.Title: The Choice
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Michael Buerk talks to people who have faced life-changing choices and dilemmas which have irrevocably altered their lives.

BasicDescription.Title: Cutting A Dash
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Changing Gear, The Comma: Lynne Truss continues to explore the changing fashions of punctuation by going into the classroom to find out how children learn to punctuate.

BasicDescription.Title: Book Of The Week
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Peacemakers: By Margaret MacMillan. President Woodrow Wilson Comes To Europe. For the first six months of 1919 Paris effectively became the capital of the world. .

BasicDescription.Title: Woman's Hour
BasicDescription.Synopsis: With Jenni Murray. Includes at 10.45am the drama Mary Hays In Love, adapted for radio and introduced by Philippa Gregory.

With Jenni Murray.
Includes at 10.45am the drama Mary Hays In Love
Adapted for radio and introduced by Philippa Gregory.
Part Two
Although forbidden to marry, Mary and John are determined to write to one another. The temperature of feeling expressed in their letters continues to rise.
Mary Hays Poppy Miller John Eccles Nick Fletcher Director Gaynor Macfarlane

BasicDescription.Title: The Thin Green Line
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Winifred Robinson continues her investigation of rural enforcement agencies with a look at the RSPCA as they set out in pursuit of badger baiters.

Continuing her 3 part investigation of rural enforcement agencies, Winifred Robinson tracks the RSPCA as they set out in pursuit of blood-sport aficionados involved in one of the most entrenched of crimes against animals - badger baiting.

BasicDescription.Title: Aynuch And Ayli
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Josie Lawrence presents a hilarious journey through the comic heritage of the West Midlands. From comedians of yesteryear like Music Hall duo Aynuck and Ayli to modern comics like Frank Skinner.

BasicDescription.Title: News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news headlines from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: You And Yours
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Consumer news and discussion with John Waite and Peter White. Includes Call You And Yours at 12.30pm - call 08700 100 444 [national rate] with your comments on today's programme.

BasicDescription.Title: The World At One
BasicDescription.Synopsis: National and international news from BBC Radio 4. With reports from our correspondents worldwide. Presented by Nick Clarke.

BasicDescription.Title: Soul Music
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The Pathetique: Tchaikovsky died only nine days after the premiere of his Pathetique Symphony No 6, but what was the importance of the piece to the Russian people.

The series about music, that makes the hairs stand up on the back of our necks.
The Pathetique
Tchaikovsky's Symphony No. 6 delighted the composer, yet he died nine days after its premiere. Biographer Anthony Holden reveals the circumstances of his death while conductor Vassily Sinaisky explains the relevance and importance of the piece to the Russian people.

BasicDescription.Title: Afternoon Play
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Maigret: The Bar On The Seine: Georges Simenon's Parisian detective investigates an old murder, and a new one, in a dramatisation by Alison Joseph.

Maigret: The Bar On The Seine
By Georges Simenon Dramatised by Alison Joseph
When a condemned man reveals the whereabouts of an unpunished murderer, Chief Inspector Maigret puts his holiday on hold. His investigation takes him to a bar on the Seine, the Guinguette ï¿½ deux sous, and the old crime is promptly upstaged by a killing. While Mme Maigret awaits him in Alsace, Maigret finds a new drinking companion in this engrossing version of a classic Simenon story.
Maigret Nicholas Le Prevost Simenon Julian Barnes Lucas Ron Cook James Timothy Watson Basso Sylvester Morand Feinstein Jonathan Tafler Mado & Mere Mathilde Tracy Wiles Mme Basso Rebecca Egan Police Officer Martin Hyder Taxi Driver Richard Firth Lenoir & Victor Scott Brooksbank Woman Emma Woolliams Woman Laura Doddington
Music by Lucinda Mason Brown Directed by Ned Chaillet

BasicDescription.Title: Making History
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Sue Cook gets to the bottom of historical mysteries, local legends, family curiosities and architectural oddities. Write to Making History, PO Box 3096, Brighton BN1 1PL.

BasicDescription.Title: The City
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The Singer And The Snake: By Olivia McCannon. In this series of stories on urban life Eve Best reads a tale about the Paris Metro, of love found and lost.

BasicDescription.Title: Herbs: Pure And Simple
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The Lily Family: Herb farmer Jekka McVicar visits the Geffrye Museum in London. Joined by Deputy Director Christine Lalumia they discover the secrets of the Lily family.

The Lily Family
Herb farmer Jekka McVicar visits the Geffrye Museum in London. Joined by Deputy Director Christine Lalumia they discover the secrets of the Lily family which include onion, garlic and chives.

BasicDescription.Title: More Or Less
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Andrew Dilnot presents the series that explores numbers and their place in the world around us.

BasicDescription.Title: A Good Read
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Rosie Boycott, Lionel Blue and the Barefoot Doctor discuss Jonathan Franzen's The Corrections, Maria McCann's As Meat Loves Salt, and Rose Macaulay's The Towers of Trebizond.

BasicDescription.Title: PM
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Full coverage and analysis of the day's news, plus the sports headlines. Presented by Clare English and Eddie Mair.

BasicDescription.Title: Six O'Clock News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: Radio Active
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Join us on a last glorious trawl through the archives of Britain's only National Local Radio Station. Written by Angus Deayton and Geoffrey Perkins.

BasicDescription.Title: The Archers
BasicDescription.Synopsis: It's chaos at the Home Farm Shoot.

BasicDescription.Title: Front Row
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Mark Lawson with the latest on the arts.

BasicDescription.Title: Mary Hays In Love
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Philippa Gregory reads the love letters sent between Mary Hays and John Eccles in 1779. Forbidden to marry, Mary and John are determined to continue corresponding.

Adapted for radio and introduced by Philippa Gregory.
Part Two
Although forbidden to marry, Mary and John are determined to write to one another. The temperature of feeling expressed in their letters continues to rise.
Mary Hays Poppy Miller John Eccles Nick Fletcher Director Gaynor Macfarlane

BasicDescription.Title: File On 4
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Esther Armah reports on major issues, changing attitudes and important events at home and abroad.

BasicDescription.Title: In Touch
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Peter White with news and information of particular interest to blind and partially-sighted people. Followed by News.

BasicDescription.Title: Case Notes
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Graham Easton talks to migraine sufferers and investigates the latest treatments for this debilitating condition.

BasicDescription.Title: The World Tonight
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Analysis of the day's national and international stories, including interviews with politicians and public figures.

BasicDescription.Title: Book At Bedtime
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Tiger In The Smoke. A Battle Of Wills: Anton Lesser reads Margery Allingham's evocative story of a mysterious treasure hunt in postwar London.

BasicDescription.Title: Arthur Smith's Last Hangover
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A year ago, Arthur Smith was close to death. He has since given up alcohol and entered the strange new world of the sober. Caroline Quentin talks him through the experience.

A year ago, Arthur Smith was nearly dead. He has subsequently given up drinking and entered the strange new world of the chronically sober. As he ruminates about his drinking days and booze generally, he discovers elderflower presse, mornings and temptation.
Old mucker actress Caroline Quentin joins Arthur in a show that might make you weep with laughter into your sherry.

BasicDescription.Title: Today In Parliament
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A review of the day's events in Parliament.
